messageBody:
Hi lranatunga,

Thanks - that seems to solve my problem ;o)

Regards
-Bo

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "lranatunga" <lranatun@s...> wrote:
> I too am relatively new to junit, but try the following revision:
>
> public class TestProject
> extends TestSuite {
>
> //...
>
> public static Test suite() {
> TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();
>
> //---instead of this:
> //suite.addTestSuite(dk.company.emc.TestPackage.class);
>
> //---try this:
> suite.addTest(dk.company.emc.TestPackage.suite());
>
> return suite;
> }
> }
>
> Note that the above:
> 1. uses addTest() instead of addTestSuite()
> 2. calls the TestPackage.suite() static method which returns a Test.
>
>
> Also, btw, if your package level suite only has a single TestCase,
you
> can use the following shortcut:
>
> public static Test suite() {
> return new TestSuite(dk.company.emc.TestPackage.class);
> }
>
> instead of:
>
> > public static Test suite() {
> > TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();
> > suite.addTestSuite(dk.company.emc.TestPackage.class);
> > return suite;
> > }
>
> cheers.
>
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "krogenlund" <krogenlund@h...> wrote:
> > Hi,
> >
> > I have a small problem using TestSuites. We organise our tests
such
> > that there is a test suite for each package, and one for the
entire
> > project. The project level suite aggregates the package suites.
The
> > problem is that when running the project level suite it says that
> > there's no tests defined for the package level suites. When I run
> the
> > package suites however things are ok! What could be wrong - I'm
> > relatively new to JUnit.
> >
> > I'm using the ant junit task
> >
> > The code for the project level suite
> >
> > public class TestProject
> > extends TestSuite {
> >
> > public TestProject(String s) {
> > super(s);
> > }
> >
> > public static Test suite() {
> > TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();
> > suite.addTestSuite(dk.company.emc.TestPackage.class);
> > return suite;
> > }
> > }
> >
> > The code for the package level suite
> >
> > public class TestPackage
> > extends TestSuite {
> >
> > public TestPackage(String s) {
> > super(s);
> > }
> >
> > public static Test suite() {
> > TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();
> > suite.addTestSuite(dk.company.emc.TestBlackBoard.class);
> > return suite;
> > }
> > }
> >
> > Thanks in advance
> > Bo
